description: The Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification is the gold standard in the IT Security field. Security professionals that have achieved their CISSP designation are regarded as some of the most talented and knowledgeable people in their field. The certification demonstrates that the holder has been working in IT Security for over five years, has a broad range of knowledge in ten domains related to creating, supporting and maintaining a secure IT infrastructure and can implement things like risk management and risk identification.
descriptionMD: The Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification is the gold standard in the IT Security field. Security professionals that have achieved their CISSP designation are regarded as some of the most talented and knowledgeable people in their field. The certification demonstrates that the holder has been working in IT Security for over five years, has a broad range of knowledge in ten domains related to creating, supporting and maintaining a secure IT infrastructure and can implement things like risk management and risk identification.
name: Certified Information Systems Security Professional (UPDATED 2018)
subtitle: CISSP

episodes.description: The Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification is the gold standard in the IT Security field. Security professionals that have achieved their CISSP designation are regarded as some of the most talented and knowledgeable people in their field. The certification demonstrates that the holder has been working in IT Security for over five years, has a broad range of knowledge in ten domains related to creating, supporting and maintaining a secure IT infrastructure and can implement things like risk management and risk identification.
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.000 --> 00:00:06.009
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:06.009 --> 00:00:08.677
In this episode we'd like
to take a few moments to

3
00:00:08.677 --> 00:00:11.880
tell you what you can expect
in the upcoming CISSP series.

4
00:00:11.880 --> 00:00:13.910
And here with our overview is Adam Gordon.

5
00:00:13.910 --> 00:00:15.110
Adam, how are we doing today?

6
00:00:15.110 --> 00:00:15.930
>> Doing well, doing well.

7
00:00:15.930 --> 00:00:16.480
How about you?

8
00:00:16.480 --> 00:00:17.140
>> I'm doing good.

9
00:00:17.140 --> 00:00:19.420
What can we expect in the upcoming series?

10
00:00:19.420 --> 00:00:21.770
>> A whole bunch of stuff
having to do with CISSP.

11
00:00:21.770 --> 00:00:22.272
>> Very good [CROSSTALK].

12
00:00:22.272 --> 00:00:24.030
>> Let's be a little bit
more specific than that.

13
00:00:24.030 --> 00:00:26.121
So if you're joining us for
the CISSP show,

14
00:00:26.121 --> 00:00:28.390
all the episodes that will make it up.

15
00:00:28.390 --> 00:00:31.640
You hopefully are aware of
the fact that in April of 2018,

16
00:00:31.640 --> 00:00:34.420
ISC Squared announced as
they do every three years,

17
00:00:34.420 --> 00:00:38.200
that there will be a revision in
some form to the knowledge base.

18
00:00:38.200 --> 00:00:41.510
What we call the CBK,
the common body of knowledge.

19
00:00:41.510 --> 00:00:45.540
Currently made up of 8 domains actually
currently since 2015 since the last

20
00:00:45.540 --> 00:00:48.924
major revision from 10 domains down to 8.

21
00:00:48.924 --> 00:00:54.230
The 2015 to 2018 revision, to 8 domains
has for the most part held true

22
00:00:54.230 --> 00:00:57.680
going into the 2018 revision,
those same 8 domains are still there,

23
00:00:57.680 --> 00:01:00.720
we've modified the name a little
bit in one or more of them.

24
00:01:00.720 --> 00:01:02.050
We've mixed and matched and

25
00:01:02.050 --> 00:01:06.360
reordered some of the topics that make up
each of the domains and moved them around,

26
00:01:06.360 --> 00:01:11.420
but really not a huge,
seismic shift the way it was going

27
00:01:11.420 --> 00:01:16.390
into the 2015 update as the move from 10
domains down to 8, so that part is good.

28
00:01:16.390 --> 00:01:18.280
We will address all eight domains and

29
00:01:18.280 --> 00:01:23.300
address them in the order that the
ISC-Squared CISSP blueprint or the exam

30
00:01:23.300 --> 00:01:26.915
signifies, meaning if you join me here,
we'll quickly show you what we are doing.

31
00:01:26.915 --> 00:01:29.150
We're going to start with Security and
Risk Management.

32
00:01:29.150 --> 00:01:32.970
And all I've done, you'll see me use this
document throughout all of the episodes.

33
00:01:32.970 --> 00:01:36.010
Is taken the exam blueprint
listing of domains and

34
00:01:36.010 --> 00:01:40.745
subtopics and just in the same order
they are produced by ISC Squared.

35
00:01:40.745 --> 00:01:44.230
Put them into a word document, simply
highlighting what we're doing at every

36
00:01:44.230 --> 00:01:48.570
stage of our discussion so you always
start every episode knowing where we are.

37
00:01:48.570 --> 00:01:51.000
We'll start with the Security and
Risk Management Domain.

38
00:01:51.000 --> 00:01:54.600
There are 12 sub topic areas
that we will go through there.

39
00:01:54.600 --> 00:01:55.710
You can see them on the screen but

40
00:01:55.710 --> 00:01:57.800
we're not too worried about
the detail right now.

41
00:01:57.800 --> 00:01:59.831
You'll get a chance to
see them in depth and

42
00:01:59.831 --> 00:02:02.152
up close as we go through
all of the discussions.

43
00:02:02.152 --> 00:02:06.650
We'll move into Asset Security,
one of the smaller domains overall.

44
00:02:06.650 --> 00:02:09.920
We'll deal with Security Architecture and
Engineering.

45
00:02:09.920 --> 00:02:14.860
This is one of the larger domains, also
one of the ones that a lot of people get

46
00:02:14.860 --> 00:02:18.040
a little put off by in the sense
that they get a little scared by.

47
00:02:18.040 --> 00:02:22.300
Because it does contain cryptography which
was a discussion area under network and

48
00:02:22.300 --> 00:02:25.340
communication security in
the old ten domain mapping.

49
00:02:25.340 --> 00:02:27.630
So obviously a very important
aspect of what we do.

50
00:02:27.630 --> 00:02:32.340
It also deals with a lot of the system
architecture that sometimes

51
00:02:32.340 --> 00:02:34.320
throws people for a bit of a loop.

52
00:02:34.320 --> 00:02:37.480
We'll try to make that as painless
as possible for you I promise.

53
00:02:37.480 --> 00:02:40.040
But it is actually a very
exciting area and one that,

54
00:02:40.040 --> 00:02:42.690
as we peel back the layers
of complexity around.

55
00:02:42.690 --> 00:02:45.980
Most people tend to find that they
actually have a fairly good grasp of,

56
00:02:45.980 --> 00:02:47.992
even though they don't know
always see that going in.

57
00:02:47.992 --> 00:02:51.650
Because it deals with a lot of
the fundamentals of what we actually do

58
00:02:51.650 --> 00:02:53.960
in the pursuit of everyday jobs and

59
00:02:53.960 --> 00:02:57.930
roles in IT, regardless of
what our focus maybe over all.

60
00:02:57.930 --> 00:03:00.040
So, we'll spend some time there certainly.

61
00:03:00.040 --> 00:03:03.550
We're also going to go through
Communication and Network Security.

62
00:03:03.550 --> 00:03:06.050
This has now became a very short domain.

63
00:03:06.050 --> 00:03:10.050
Actually the shortest of all the domains
just in terms of the number of topics, but

64
00:03:10.050 --> 00:03:12.200
still incredibly important to what we do.

65
00:03:12.200 --> 00:03:17.220
This is the bread and butter of most,
if not all of the IT professionals

66
00:03:17.220 --> 00:03:21.940
that come into the realm of CISSP
looking to ultimately certify.

67
00:03:21.940 --> 00:03:25.770
Because almost without exception, all of
us come from some sort of a background

68
00:03:25.770 --> 00:03:29.640
regardless of what we do that has a
fundamental understanding of the terms and

69
00:03:29.640 --> 00:03:31.590
the techniques we will discuss here.

70
00:03:31.590 --> 00:03:34.580
Identity and
Access Management will be very important,

71
00:03:34.580 --> 00:03:38.720
especially these days in the world
of web services and the Cloud.

72
00:03:38.720 --> 00:03:40.890
So domain Five overall.

73
00:03:40.890 --> 00:03:42.840
Domain six, Security Assessment and

74
00:03:42.840 --> 00:03:46.600
Testing, that's the one that sometimes
people get a little put off by because

75
00:03:46.600 --> 00:03:48.910
they don't feel they have
a lot of knowledge in.

76
00:03:48.910 --> 00:03:51.600
And unlike domain three for
Systems Architecture and

77
00:03:51.600 --> 00:03:54.160
Engineering, where our
security architecture and

78
00:03:54.160 --> 00:03:57.920
engineering, where we do find that we
do have a background as we get into it.

79
00:03:57.920 --> 00:04:01.336
If you haven't really done assessment and
testing work before,

80
00:04:01.336 --> 00:04:05.310
you can feel a little strange and a little
bit of an alien like environment for

81
00:04:05.310 --> 00:04:08.353
us to be discussing, but
rest assured it's actually very

82
00:04:08.353 --> 00:04:11.750
straightforward conversation,
that'll be domain six.

83
00:04:11.750 --> 00:04:16.370
Domain seven, Security Operations
by far in a way the largest of

84
00:04:16.370 --> 00:04:20.500
all the domains as you can see,
very, very big, lots of stuff there.

85
00:04:20.500 --> 00:04:23.270
But again,
a fairly straightforward conversation.

86
00:04:23.270 --> 00:04:25.710
We see some oldies and goodies like BCDR,

87
00:04:25.710 --> 00:04:28.950
business continuity disaster
recovery planning appear there.

88
00:04:28.950 --> 00:04:31.160
Physical security, things of that nature.

89
00:04:31.160 --> 00:04:34.926
And then rounding out with domain
eight Software Development Security,

90
00:04:34.926 --> 00:04:39.239
where we discuss development life cycles,
development methodologies and discuss

91
00:04:39.239 --> 00:04:43.810
a variety of different things associated
with how we can understand what happens.

92
00:04:43.810 --> 00:04:47.230
From a development perspective with regard
to the software that many of us take for

93
00:04:47.230 --> 00:04:48.460
granted all the time.

94
00:04:48.460 --> 00:04:50.940
We use, but we don't necessarily
understand the security.

95
00:04:50.940 --> 00:04:53.960
So we'll have some interesting
conversations associated with that.

96
00:04:53.960 --> 00:04:55.300
All together all up,

97
00:04:55.300 --> 00:05:00.090
those eight domains make up
the CISSP CBK common body of knowledge.

98
00:05:00.090 --> 00:05:01.610
We will spend time going through each and

99
00:05:01.610 --> 00:05:03.960
every one of them,
looking in all the nooks and crannies and

100
00:05:03.960 --> 00:05:07.160
all the different corners associated
with those conversations.

101
00:05:07.160 --> 00:05:10.516
At the end of every one of those
domain blocks of knowledge,

102
00:05:10.516 --> 00:05:12.194
we've instituted a wrap up or

103
00:05:12.194 --> 00:05:16.824
key points additional episode that kind of
reviews and hits the highlights for you

104
00:05:16.824 --> 00:05:21.521
and reinforces those key points you should
go back and make sure you're studying so

105
00:05:21.521 --> 00:05:24.571
you have a nice way of wrapping
all that knowledge up.

106
00:05:24.571 --> 00:05:28.723
We also have a block of resources,
both show notes and often additional

107
00:05:28.723 --> 00:05:33.636
supplementary documentary material that we
will refer to in many of our episodes and

108
00:05:33.636 --> 00:05:37.717
that we make available to you downloadable
as part of the show notes and

109
00:05:37.717 --> 00:05:39.610
the attachment to the episode.

110
00:05:39.610 --> 00:05:41.110
So make sure you look for that.

111
00:05:41.110 --> 00:05:42.930
It's got all sorts of documents.

112
00:05:42.930 --> 00:05:46.690
It's got all the NIST standards that we
reference that are freely available and

113
00:05:46.690 --> 00:05:50.350
any other things that I think may be
valuable that will be helpful for you.

114
00:05:50.350 --> 00:05:53.830
Including a glossary of terms,
you have a vocabulary list.

115
00:05:53.830 --> 00:05:56.360
That you can use to study there and
make flash cards from.

116
00:05:56.360 --> 00:05:58.870
And you'll hear me refer to the importance
of flash cards time and again.

117
00:05:58.870 --> 00:06:02.210
So I look forward, as I know Wes does
as well, to spending time with you.

118
00:06:02.210 --> 00:06:05.060
You'll see some new faces popping
in here from time to time.

119
00:06:05.060 --> 00:06:06.350
It won't just be Wes.

120
00:06:06.350 --> 00:06:09.230
We'll have Daniel join us and
maybe one or two other surprise guests.

121
00:06:09.230 --> 00:06:10.340
We'll see how that goes.

122
00:06:10.340 --> 00:06:12.350
But certainly look for
myself, look for all of us.

123
00:06:12.350 --> 00:06:15.351
And we look forward to seeing
you as we discuss CISSP and

124
00:06:15.351 --> 00:06:18.690
the CBK that makes up the knowledge
base associated with it.

125
00:06:18.690 --> 00:06:23.751
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss the concepts of confidentiality, integrity & availability.
episodes.title: Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability (CIA)

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss the concepts of confidentiality, integrity & availability.
episodes.title: Confidentiality, Integrity, Availability (CIA) Pt2

episodes.description: Adam and Wes discuss the alignment of security function to business strategy, goals, mission, and objectives. They also examine the importance of organizational processes, roles and responsibilities. The need for well defined and documented security control frameworks is touched upon along with the need to clear define concepts of due care and due diligence within the organization.
episodes.title: Evaluate, Apply Security Governance Principles

The need for well defined and documented security control frameworks is touched upon along with the need to clear define concepts of due care and due diligence within the organization.

episodes.title: Conduct Security Control Testing Part 3

episodes.title: Collect Security Process Data

episodes.title: Security Assessment and Testing - Key Points

episodes.title: Conduct Logging and Monitoring Activities
